runs.comm: starts off with a back-of-a-length delivery, Gambhir looks to drop and run, Dilshan at cover-point makes sure it doesn't happen
driven on the up, powerfully, and the oldest international cricketer in the world, Jayasuriya, dives to his left and saves three runs
back of a length, Sehwag goes deep into the crease and flicks it into the on side for one
Gambhir, pushed into the crease because Sanga is standing up, goes for the big heave, gets an inside edge, and takes a single to short fine
stays back of a length to Sehwag, it stops on him a touch and he plays it back to the bowler
what a shot, Sehwag steps out, makes room, makes clean contact and goes up and over extra cover. Superb shot
Gambhir moves away to the leg side, and then bunt it for one, but misses, and is relieved to see the leg stump standing
again he looks to make room, again Kula follows him, again he looks to play with soft hands, and gets a fine inside edge for four, unlucky for the bowler
walks across the stumps this time, looking to work it to the on side, misses it and the bounce saves him from the lbw
dabs this one down to third man for one

and now SL miss a run-out, something in the air? Sehwag crashes this straight to extra cover, where Jayasinghe fumbles. He comes through for one, but the ball hasn;t gone too far and he gives up. But the throw is a half-volley to Kula and he doesn't colelct cleanly and Sehwag gets a reprieve
Gambhir gets a single to third man again, opens the face at the last moment
swipes across the line, not pretty but pretty safe because there is no deep midwicket, gets two
slower ball, Gambhir goes for the cut but can neither time it nor place it, finds cover

another run-out missed, what's happening here? Gambhir hits powerfully and straight to Jayasuriya at mid-off, and gives up mid-way. Jaya waits for a second but finds the bowler hasn't come back to collect the throw and misses out non the direct hit himself
slower ball down the leg side, Sehwag looks for easy boundary but misses, gets a wide nevertheless
another lovely shot from Sehwag, he makes room again, takes a length delivery and lofts it over extra cover. That's a second similar shot in two overs from Weeraratne

Sri Lanka are giving India tough competition in the field, now a drop by Jayasuriya, Sehwag mis-hits and skies a straight hit, Jaya runs in from long-on, has enough time to get there but is not sure whether Dilhara Fernando from mdiwicket is also going for it. In the end he doesn't even get a finger to it. Calling is conspicuous by its absence
works this length delivery away for a single
full and wide, crashed away towards sweeper-cover for one
full and wide again, played straight to backward point, they rush through for one, and get an overthrow in bonus

this is not happening seriously, is it? another run-out missed, Gambhir hits hard and straight to cover, wants a non-existent single, is sent back, Mathews goes for a direct hit and misses. Gambhir is not even in the frame, and Sanga is exasperated, almost begging his fielders for common sense. had he thrown this to Sanga, this would have been a run-out
dances down the track, turns this into a fulltoss, and drives it straight down the ground. The timing is superb, and he will get a four
digs out a yorker and gets a single toward short third man
starts with a short, straight and fast delivery, Sehwag pushes it to point
misses the radar this time, and gives away a wide down the leg side
back of a length, pushing him into the crease, he works it away to fine leg for one

another possible run-out, this time Gambhir is caught napping, he just bunts this short ball towards short fine and ambles through for one. Only when Dilshan's throw misses the stumps by inches and he is still feet away from the crease does he realise he has been lazy
smart shot, this is a short delivery, fine leg is square, so he waits an extra second, stands tall, and glances it fine. The outfield is too fast here
goes back into the crease and flicks, can't beat midwicket
bouncer surprises Sehwag who is looking to come forward, but it's too high and is called wide
played towards mid-on with soft hands, and he comes through for an easy single
walks down the track, turns this into a fulltoss, and smashes it across the line, through midwicket, India's 50 coming up
another low fulltoss, but Sehwag has tonight looked to play him into the sparsely populated on side, as he does again and gets a single to wide of mid-on
this may as well be school cricket, Gambhir plays towards mid-off at the edge of the circle, comes through for one, and a wild wild throw from Malinga gives them an overthrow
full and outside off, he makes room and drives, Mathews at extra cover fumbles and costs them an extra run
looks to back away and run it down but misses

Gambhir has tempted fate once too often, and this partnership ends in an error again. Gambhir's drive to the right of Malinga at mid-off is misfielded. One becomes two. Gambhir wants to turn it into three. Sehwag checks his greed, and sends him back. He is slow in turning back, doesn't dive, the relay throw from Kula is accurate and catches him inches short. Perhaps there were three there and Sehwag wasn't alert
another run-out missed here, silly run again, Sehwag misses a flick, the ball goes one bounce to Dilshan at point, and gives up again. Dilshan misses the stumps again
and Dhoni is beaten neck and crop first ball. Back of a length, extra bounce, holds its line, just doesn't get the edge
sharp single again, Dhoni gets off the mark by bunting one to mid-on
goes for the pull, but this bouncer is well directed and gets big on him, he ends up lobbing into the on side for two
nice shot, makes room, Fernando follows him, he makes more room and cuts it over point and it speeds across the outfield
length ball, in Sehwag's zone, he hits it powerfully but straight to midwicket

is this the worst day for fielding ever? fulltoss on the pads, Dhoni plays the pick-up, Kapuegedera at deep square leg doesn't judge it and mis-times the jump too. Why is he not at the edge of the boundary anyway? Another drop
it's air time here, the Dhoni helicopter shot connects, overpitched, on the stumps, and he has absolutely murdered it straight down the ground
yorker length this time, and he gets a single down to long-off

Sorry guys, I am rolling on the floor laughing, another misfield. Even the ball has started playing tricks here. Sehwag goes for the inside shot again. Kulasekara does well, gets around, makes allowance for the spin away as this is a slice, but it spins the other way. I wouldn't have believed it had I not seen it
powerful hit, down to long-on, gets one
bouncer, Sehwag pulls, gets the toe end, but it lands in no-man's land and he gets two
first bit of sensible running. Sehwag has hit this powerfully to mid-on. Dhoni wants one, but is sent back. Rightly

smart shot, a Danny Vettori speciality, walks across the stumps, thereby allowing himself to pulls this ball very fine, almost helping it along its way. We saw this shot early in the morning in the Napier Test from vettori
makes room, Fernando digs it in short, he hits this one to wide of mid-off for one
nice yorker, played back to the bowler
opens the face to a length delivery around one and takes a single
gets across and flicks the ball off middle and leg, beats the man at square leg and urges Sehwag on the for the couple, but they only get one in the end
what a shot! Backs away and gets underneath it to loft that over extra cover for half a dozen, cuing hysteria in the crowd, his third such shot over that region
well bowled, aims for the blockhole and ends up bowling a yorker outside off stump, Sehwag jams the bat down and is beaten
well that's just flayed! Sehwag again backs away and absolutely throws the bat at ball, slashing it just over a leaping Jayawardene at cover and beating the sweeper too
now he goes on side, biffing it over the man at midwicket
goes full and Dhoni flat-bats it down to long-off with that trademark whip, running hard
short, into the pads, Sehwag gets across, but misses the pull-flick and gets a leg-bye
just back of a length, on the stumps, 143ks, worked away to the on side
well bowled, sees Sehwag makes room, fires in a yorker just outside off, no way he is getting runs off this one
stands his ground this time, takes the slower ball and flicks it away for one
another slower one, forced away from outside off towards sweeper-cover

he has holed out in the deep, excellent over for SL, four runs and Sehwag's wicket. Another slower ball, Sehwag's idea is right in going straight but he gets too much elevation and long-on has enough time to come around and hold on to it
Mathews bowl a wide yorker, Yuvraj digs it out and gets a single
Dhoni goes over extra, not timed perfectly, but has enough to clear the infield and get him two runs
Dhoni seems in the mood today, walks across, and thumps a length delivery over wide long-on, and it's flat. Awesome power
another length ball, hit down the ground for one
low fulltoss, and an elegant lofted shot straight down the ground, high elbow and all. Jayasinghe at long-on does well to get a hand to it and keep them to two
another powerful straight hit, and Jayasinghe is very very straight, and it's just a single
slower delivery, nicely played, waits for it, opens the face at the last moment, and gets it to fine of third man and comes back for two
that's Yuvraj's birthday gift, a nice juicy fulltoss, and Yuvraj accepts it with gratitude, getting over extra cover. Encashes the gift voucher really
incredible shot, he hardly seems to have hit it, long-off is interested, but is helpless. Not smart bowling, though, fulltoss followed by a length ball
full and wide, and crashed through to sweeper-cover for one
driven down the ground, gets a single
and a big wide outside off
ho ho ho, bye bye ball, length ball again, Yuvraj can get under it, big back lift, clean followthrough, it's way way back in the crowd
Jayasuriya lets another one through his legs. Dhoni forces a back-of-a-length delivery to point, and Jaya gets bad bounce at the wrong time
gets across and bunts this one for a single into the on side
slower ball, driven down the ground for one
that's another Dhoni speciality, short and wide, he frees his arms, deliberately gets under it and goes over point. SL need to plug the holes big time
short again, pulled away to deep square leg for one
good bouncer, more so because Yuvraj is expecting a yorker, he ducks in awkwardly, SL get an important dot ball
good slower ball, the knuckle variety, tough to pick, and Dhoni plays it back to the bowler, dot ball
another slower ball, too full, and he gets a single down to long-on
full delivery, just outside off, driven down the ground for one
the yorker goes wrong by inches, and the last-moment flick of wrists carries it to wide of long-on. Margin of error, what margin of error?
short, cramps him up, and he cuts to sweeper-cover, the 50 of the partnership up, in 23 balls
slower ball, Yuvraj goes deep in the crease and bunts it down for one
looks for the yorker outside off, goes too wide, Sanga is not happy with the call
what a shot, amazing, over extra cover, clean swing, high elbow, what else you want? Kula, though, can do better than bowl length outside off
miscued pull shot, and just because it is not timed well it doesn't reach the fielder fast enough and they get two

this is poor bowling and he is cashing in beautifully, another length ball, straighter this time, he goes over long-on this time, timing is perfect, he holds the pose as everybody watches it sail over

I haven't seen collective worse fielding ever in an international match. It's Dilshan this time. This is hit straight and powerfully towards long-off, Dilshan has to take three steps to his left but he takes five, and having over-run it he - well - drops it
good yorker, finally he gets it right, but is it too late?
and he bowls length again, and Yuvraj is in no mood to miss out, goes straight again. Both long-on and long-off are pretty straight but can't make it - it's so straight and fast
slower ball, Dhoni is early into the pull but keeps it along the ground, and says "over to you Yuvraj"
strays on the pads, gets away with just a single
quicker short delivery this time, he is late into the shot but it rolls towards fine leg
Yuvraj gets 50, off just 20 balls. Slower ball, he opens the face and takes a single to cover
pulled again, not convincingly, but he manages to clear midwicket and gets two
superb yorker, inswinging, beating the high backlift. The stumps are in a mess. But the question is, has this come just in time or is too late?
slower ball, runs it down to third man. Surely looking to play out Malinga's last over?
yorker it is, but it is angled too far down the leg side, he tickles it down to fine leg and Malinga's pace takes it to the boundary
yes it is a slower one, Raina goes deep into the crease and tucks it away for one
full, fast, yorker, digs it out, gets a single to long-off
that's quick, Raina looks to open the face and is beaten by the pace
that's the end of Malinga, full delivery, straight, played back to the bowler
short and wide, and cut away to sweeper cover for one
and Raina has brought it down to less than run-a-ball, charges down, makes room, and lofts him over extra cover
goes for the big slog, a hopeful Sanga appeals, but it is clearly angling down the leg side

finally they hit the stumps direct. Raina pushes to cover and runs. There is no run in this and Kulasekara underarms it. Raina dives desperately. By the time the bail comes off completely, Raina's bat has reached past the crease but is in the air
pushes it to cover and gets a single
that is cheeky, Karthik is a smart T20 batsman, he waits for this short delivery, and late-cuts it from inside Sanga's gloves it seems. No chance for the third man to save the boundary
and going by the scripts of the night, Mathews gives him a nice length ball, gentle pace, Yuvraj gets under it, clears his arms and sends it into the crowd behind long-on
